item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://stevelovenz.xyz.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Refund and Returns Policy
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
This is a sample page.

Overview

Our refund and returns policy lasts 30 days. If 30 days have passed since your purchase, we can’t offer you a full refund or exchange.

To be eligible for a return, your item must be unused and in the same condition that you received it. It must also be in the original packaging.

Several types of goods are exempt from being returned. Perishable goods such as food, flowers, newspapers or magazines cannot be returned. We also do not accept products that are intimate or sanitary goods, hazardous materials, or flammable liquids or gases.

Additional non-returnable items:

  • Gift cards
  • Downloadable software products
  • Some health and personal care items

To complete your return, we require a receipt or proof of purchase.

Please do not send your purchase back to the manufacturer.

There are certain situations where only partial refunds are granted:

  • Book with obvious signs of use
  • CD, DVD, VHS tape, software, video game, cassette tape, or vinyl record that has been opened.
  • Any item not in its original condition, is damaged or missing parts for reasons not due to our error.
  • Any item that is returned more than 30 days after delivery

Refunds

Once your return is received and inspected, we will send you an email to notify you that we have received your returned item. We will also notify you of the approval or rejection of your refund.

If you are approved, then your refund will be processed, and a credit will automatically be applied to your credit card or original method of payment, within a certain amount of days.

Late or missing refunds

If you haven’t received a refund yet, first check your bank account again.

Then contact your credit card company, it may take some time before your refund is officially posted.

Next contact your bank. There is often some processing time before a refund is posted.

If you’ve done all of this and you still have not received your refund yet, please contact us at {email address}.

Sale items

Only regular priced items may be refunded. Sale items cannot be refunded.

Exchanges

We only replace items if they are defective or damaged. If you need to exchange it for the same item, send us an email at {email address} and send your item to: {physical address}.

Gifts

If the item was marked as a gift when purchased and shipped directly to you, you’ll receive a gift credit for the value of your return. Once the returned item is received, a gift certificate will be mailed to you.

If the item wasn’t marked as a gift when purchased, or the gift giver had the order shipped to themselves to give to you later, we will send a refund to the gift giver and they will find out about your return.

Shipping returns

To return your product, you should mail your product to: {physical address}.

You will be responsible for paying for your own shipping costs for returning your item. Shipping costs are non-refundable. If you receive a refund, the cost of return shipping will be deducted from your refund.

Depending on where you live, the time it may take for your exchanged product to reach you may vary.

If you are returning more expensive items, you may consider using a trackable shipping service or purchasing shipping insurance. We don’t guarantee that we will receive your returned item.

Need help?

Contact us at {email} for questions related to refunds and returns.

item.title: How to choose jewellers
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
Choosing the right jeweler is essential when purchasing jewelry, as it ensures the quality, authenticity, and service you receive. Here are some steps to help you choose the right jeweler:

1. **Research**: Start by researching jewelers in your area or online. Look for reputable jewelers with positive reviews, certifications, and a long-standing reputation for quality and customer service.

2. **Check Credentials**: Verify the credentials and certifications of the jeweler. Accreditation from organizations like the Gemological Institute of America (GIA) or the Jewelers of America (JA) can indicate a commitment to quality and ethical practices.

3. **Visit the Store**: If possible, visit the jeweler's store to assess their inventory, craftsmanship, and customer service. Pay attention to the store's cleanliness, organization, and overall atmosphere.

4. **Ask Questions**: Don't hesitate to ask the jeweler questions about their products, services, and policies. Inquire about their expertise, warranties, return policies, and any additional services they offer, such as resizing or repairs.

5. **Inspect the Jewelry**: Examine the jewelry on display to assess the quality of craftsmanship, materials, and gemstones. Look for hallmarks or stamps indicating the metal purity and authenticity of the gemstones.

6. **Compare Prices**: Compare prices and offerings from different jewelers to ensure you're getting a fair price for the quality of the jewelry. Keep in mind that cheaper prices may indicate lower quality or unethical practices, while higher prices may reflect premium materials and craftsmanship.

7. **Read Reviews**: Read reviews and testimonials from previous customers to gauge their satisfaction with the jeweler's products and services. Online review platforms, social media, and word-of-mouth recommendations can provide valuable insights.

8. **Inquire About Customization**: If you're interested in custom-designed jewelry, inquire about the jeweler's customization services. A reputable jeweler should be able to work with you to create a personalized piece tailored to your preferences and budget.

9. **Consider After-Sales Service**: Consider the jeweler's after-sales service, including warranties, maintenance, and repair services. Choose a jeweler who offers reliable customer support and stands behind their products.

10. **Trust Your Instincts**: Ultimately, trust your instincts when choosing a jeweler. Select a jeweler who makes you feel comfortable, valued, and confident in your purchase decision.

By following these steps and conducting thorough research, you can find a reputable jeweler who offers high-quality jewelry, excellent customer service, and a positive shopping experience.

1. **Research**: Start by researching jewelers in your area or online. Look for reputable jewelers with positive reviews, certifications, and a long-standing reputation for quality and customer service.

2. **Check Credentials**: Verify the credentials and certifications of the jeweler. Accreditation from organizations like the Gemological Institute of America (GIA) or the Jewelers of America (JA) can indicate a commitment to quality and ethical practices.

3. **Visit the Store**: If possible, visit the jeweler's store to assess their inventory, craftsmanship, and customer service. Pay attention to the store's cleanliness, organization, and overall atmosphere.

4. **Ask Questions**: Don't hesitate to ask the jeweler questions about their products, services, and policies. Inquire about their expertise, warranties, return policies, and any additional services they offer, such as resizing or repairs.

5. **Inspect the Jewelry**: Examine the jewelry on display to assess the quality of craftsmanship, materials, and gemstones. Look for hallmarks or stamps indicating the metal purity and authenticity of the gemstones.

6. **Compare Prices**: Compare prices and offerings from different jewelers to ensure you're getting a fair price for the quality of the jewelry. Keep in mind that cheaper prices may indicate lower quality or unethical practices, while higher prices may reflect premium materials and craftsmanship.

7. **Read Reviews**: Read reviews and testimonials from previous customers to gauge their satisfaction with the jeweler's products and services. Online review platforms, social media, and word-of-mouth recommendations can provide valuable insights.

8. **Inquire About Customization**: If you're interested in custom-designed jewelry, inquire about the jeweler's customization services. A reputable jeweler should be able to work with you to create a personalized piece tailored to your preferences and budget.

9. **Consider After-Sales Service**: Consider the jeweler's after-sales service, including warranties, maintenance, and repair services. Choose a jeweler who offers reliable customer support and stands behind their products.

10. **Trust Your Instincts**: Ultimately, trust your instincts when choosing a jeweler. Select a jeweler who makes you feel comfortable, valued, and confident in your purchase decision.

By following these steps and conducting thorough research, you can find a reputable jeweler who offers high-quality jewelry, excellent customer service, and a positive shopping experience.

"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":false}]

item.title: How to choose necklaces
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
Choosing a necklace involves considering various factors, including personal style, occasion, neckline, and budget. Here's a guide to help you choose the perfect necklace:

1. **Consider the Occasion**: Determine the purpose of the necklace. Are you looking for a casual everyday piece, a statement necklace for a special event, or something more formal? The occasion will influence the style and type of necklace you choose.

2. **Know Your Neckline**: Different necklace lengths and styles complement different necklines. For example:
- For a scoop or V-neckline, opt for a pendant or layered necklace to fill the space.
- With a high neckline or turtleneck, choose longer necklaces like opera or rope length to create balance.
- Strapless or off-the-shoulder tops pair well with choker or collar necklaces to draw attention to the neck and collarbone.

3. **Consider Your Personal Style**: Choose a necklace that reflects your personal style and preferences. Whether you prefer minimalist designs, bold statement pieces, or classic elegance, there's a necklace to suit every style.

4. **Choose the Right Length**: Necklaces come in various lengths, including:
- Choker: Sits snugly around the neck.
- Princess: Hangs just below the collarbone.
- Matinee: Falls at the top of the bust.
- Opera: Rests at the center of the chest.
- Rope: Falls below the bust or can be doubled for a layered look.
Choose a length that complements your neckline and desired look.

5. **Select the Metal**: Consider the metal of the necklace based on your skin tone and personal preference. Common options include gold, silver, rose gold, and platinum. Choose a metal that complements your skin tone and matches your existing jewelry.

6. **Choose the Pendant or Design**: If you're opting for a necklace with a pendant or charm, consider the design, size, and meaning behind it. Whether it's a birthstone, initial, symbol, or meaningful charm, choose a pendant that resonates with you.

7. **Think About Layering**: Layering necklaces can add depth and dimension to your look. Mix and match different lengths, textures, and styles to create a personalized layered necklace stack.

8. **Consider Versatility**: Choose a necklace that can be worn with a variety of outfits and easily transitions from day to night. Versatile necklaces, such as simple chains or minimalist pendants, are great wardrobe staples.

9. **Try It On**: If possible, try on the necklace to see how it looks and feels on you. Pay attention to how it complements your neckline and overall appearance.

10. **Set a Budget**: Determine your budget before shopping for a necklace. Whether you're looking for a budget-friendly option or a high-end investment piece, there are necklaces available at various price points.

By considering these factors, you can choose a necklace that suits your style, flatters your neckline, and adds the perfect finishing touch to your outfits.

item.title: How to choose ear rings
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
Choosing earrings can also be a personal and enjoyable process. Here are some steps to help you choose the perfect pair:

1. **Consider the Occasion**: Similar to rings, think about the occasion for which you'll be wearing the earrings. Are they for everyday wear, a special event, or a formal occasion? This will help determine the style and type of earrings you choose.

2. **Know Your Budget**: Set a budget before you start shopping for earrings. Earrings come in a wide range of prices, so knowing how much you're willing to spend will help narrow down your options.

3. **Understand Metal Options**: Earrings are made from various metals, including gold, silver, platinum, and more affordable options like stainless steel or brass. Consider any metal allergies and your personal style preferences when choosing the metal for your earrings.

4. **Choose a Style**: Earrings come in countless styles, including studs, hoops, dangles, chandeliers, and ear cuffs, among others. Consider your face shape, hair length, and personal style when choosing the style of earrings that will best complement your look.

5. **Consider Size and Weight**: Take into account the size and weight of the earrings, especially if you'll be wearing them for an extended period. Heavy earrings can be uncomfortable, so opt for lightweight styles if you plan to wear them for long periods of time.

6. **Think About Gemstones and Materials**: If you're choosing earrings with gemstones, consider factors such as color, clarity, and durability. Additionally, think about other materials used in the earrings, such as pearls, diamonds, or enamel, and how they complement your overall look.

7. **Consider Your Hairstyle**: Your hairstyle can influence the type of earrings that will best suit you. For example, if you have short hair or wear your hair up often, larger statement earrings may be more visible and impactful. On the other hand, if you have long hair, studs or smaller hoops may be a better choice.

8. **Match with Your Wardrobe**: Think about your wardrobe and the colors and styles of clothing you typically wear. Choose earrings that will complement your outfits and enhance your overall look.

9. **Try Them On**: If possible, try on different styles of earrings to see how they look on you. Pay attention to how they frame your face and how they make you feel. Sometimes, seeing earrings on yourself can help you make a decision more easily.

10. **Trust Your Instincts**: Ultimately, choose earrings that make you feel confident and beautiful. Trust your instincts and select a pair that speaks to your personal style and preferences. Whether you prefer classic studs or bold statement earrings, the most important thing is that you feel comfortable and happy wearing them.

item.title: How to choose rings
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
Choosing rings can be a deeply personal and meaningful process, whether you're selecting one for yourself or for someone else. Here are some steps to help guide you through the process:

1. **Consider the Occasion**: Determine the purpose of the ring. Are you looking for an engagement ring, a wedding band, a promise ring, a fashion ring, or something else? The occasion will often dictate the style and type of ring you choose.

2. **Know Your Budget**: Before you start shopping, it's important to have a clear understanding of your budget. Rings can vary greatly in price, so knowing what you're comfortable spending will help narrow down your options.

3. **Understand Metal Options**: Rings come in a variety of metals, including gold, silver, platinum, and more recently, alternative metals like titanium and tungsten. Each metal has its own unique properties and aesthetic appeal, so consider which metal best suits your style and preferences.

4. **Choose a Style**: Rings come in countless styles, from classic and traditional to modern and trendy. Think about the recipient's personal style and taste, as well as any specific design elements they may prefer, such as gemstones, engravings, or intricate details.

5. **Consider Lifestyle**: Take into account the lifestyle of the person who will be wearing the ring. For example, someone with an active lifestyle may prefer a more durable and low-maintenance ring, while someone who works in a professional setting may prefer something more refined and elegant.

6. **Find the Right Size**: If you're buying a ring for someone else, it's important to know their ring size. You can discreetly borrow one of their rings to have it measured at a jeweler, or you can use online resources to estimate their size based on their finger measurements.

7. **Research Gemstones (if applicable)**: If you're choosing a ring with gemstones, take the time to research different types of stones and their meanings. Consider factors such as color, clarity, and durability, as well as any personal significance the gemstone may have.

8. **Shop Around**: Take your time to explore different jewelers and retailers to find the perfect ring. Don't be afraid to ask questions and seek guidance from knowledgeable sales associates.

9. **Consider Customization**: If you're unable to find exactly what you're looking for, consider having a ring custom-made. This allows you to create a one-of-a-kind piece that perfectly reflects your vision and preferences.

10. **Trust Your Instincts**: Ultimately, the most important thing is to choose a ring that feels right to you or the person you're buying it for. Trust your instincts and select a ring that brings joy and meaning to the occasion.

item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
About us

                                                                                                                                    Our Story

In the heart of a bustling city, nestled between towering skyscrapers, lay Floveo, a quaint jewelry store emanating an aura of warmth and affection. Owned by the talented jeweler, Amelia, each piece within Floveo's elegant displays held a story of love and sentimentality.

One crisp autumn day, Lily and James, a young couple deeply in love, stepped into Floveo in search of the perfect engagement ring. As they shared their love story with Amelia, her eyes twinkled with excitement, understanding the significance of their quest.

After exploring the exquisite collection, Lily's gaze fell upon a stunning diamond ring, delicately crafted in rose gold. Its design seemed to encapsulate the timelessness of their love. With trembling hands, James slid the ring onto Lily's finger, a tear of joy glistening in her eye.

As they left Floveo hand in hand, their hearts brimming with love, Lily and James knew their journey together had been blessed by the magic of Floveo. In the days to come, they embarked on a new chapter of their lives, their love illuminated by the precious jewel they found at Floveo, a testament to the enduring power of love.

Shine like a star

There can be few pieces of jewellery as instantly recognisable as Cartier’s love bracelet . Conceived by the designer Aldo Cipullo for Cartier New York in 1969, it was created out of Cipullo’s fascination with the theme of hardware (he later created the brand’s iconic Clou nail jewellery) and of his desire to create a permanent symbol of love, “something that no one could take away from me,” he said at the time.

Peter Stanton, CEO

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Viverra ipsum nunc aliquet bibendum enim facilisis gravida. Blandit turpis cursus in hac habitasse platea dictumst quisque. Gravida cum sociis natoque penatibus et. Adipiscing elit pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et. Aliquam sem fringilla ut morbi tincidunt augue interdum. Enim blandit volutpat maecenas volutpat blandit aliquam etiam erat velit. Vitae justo eget magna fermentum iaculis. item.title: Minim Veniam
item.dc:creator: stevehuinnz@gmial.com
item.content:encoded:
A modern, mixed metal engagement ring adds sparkle and shine to your 1.5ct round center stone. The straight shank features a central strand of shining 14K yellow gold flanked by two rows of round accent stones U-set in 14K white gold. This polished 0.50ct diamond setting is perfect for those with more streamlined style.
  • *All engagement ring settings are available in 14kt and 18kt Yellow, Rose and White Gold as well as Platinum.
  • *Most engagement ring settings are available in alternate center stone shapes and carat weights via special order.
Embrace timeless beauty with our 10 karat yellow gold and radiant cut laboratory-grown diamond solitaire stud earrings, with 1.00 total carat weight. The stones are in VS clarity and FG colour, offering a touch of modern sophistication. They are securely prong-set and feature push butterfly backing for your comfort. Backed by our Lifetime Diamond Warranty.
item.excerpt:encoded: Cultured Freshwater Pearl Necklace in 10kt Yellow Gold
